comments: Daniel is not going to tell you what to do, but that is not what an art class is about. Art courses involve a kind of growth and expansion that takes patience and alternative routes, and this is something daniel facilitates really well. Taking a class from him is more like having regular critiques with a friend you really respect.

Daniel was the reason I FINALLY graduated from Hampshire College. He mentored me and gave me great guidance throughout my thesis project. At times I felt like I couldnt make it and he helped get me through these tough times. Daniel is a great professor and an amazing person.

Incomprehensible, disorganized, mismanaged time, did not explain assignments, lacked method, didn\'t teach technique or components of composition which was one of the goals described in the course\'s summary. I paid TUITION to do what I had been doing for free in my own house: blindly applying paint to canvas. I learned nothing.
Daniel is an excellent professor. He is an incredible artist as well. He gives useful advice and encourages students to explore their capacities of creativity.

I have mixed feelings about him. While he seems to have a lot to say, he doesn\'t communicate it very well. He was unclear in what assignments were supposed to be and didn\'t really seem to push anyone to do their best. On the flip side, his openness allowed a lot of room to experiment and take control of what you wanted to paint- it was purely what
